feed.title: Welcome to HCLS AI/ML Content Catalog
feed.subtitle: This is the content archive for HCLS AI/ML artifacts (blogs, workshops, solutions).

entry.title: Build and Deploy Many Models Leveraging Cancer Gene Expression Data With SageMaker Pipelines and SageMaker Multi-Model Endpoints

link.title: Build and Deploy Many Models Leveraging Cancer Gene Expression Data With SageMaker Pipelines and SageMaker Multi-Model Endpoints

entry.content:
In the context of survival analysis for cancer, a common approach is to analyze gene signatures, and to predict the survival of patients based on the gene expression signatures. In this blog post, we show how you can leverage SageMaker Pipelines and SageMaker MultiModel Endpoints to build and deploy many such models.

Resources :

  • Blog
entry.summary: In the context of survival analysis for cancer, a common approach is to analyze gene signatures, and to predict the survival of patients based on the gene expression signatures. In this blog post, we show how you can leverage SageMaker Pipelines and SageMaker MultiModel Endpoints to build and deploy many such models.

entry.title: Summarize Scientific Documents with Amazon Comprehend and HuggingFace

link.title: Summarize Scientific Documents with Amazon Comprehend and HuggingFace

entry.content:
In this workshop, we’ll use several AWS AI/ML services to process scientific documents from the NIH NCBI PMC Article Dataset on the Registry of Open Data. This is a free full-text archive of biomedical and life sciences journal article at the U.S. National Institutes of Health’s National Library of Medicine.

Link to the workshop
entry.summary: In this workshop, we’ll use several AWS AI/ML services to process scientific documents from the NIH NCBI PMC Article Dataset on the Registry of Open Data. This is a free full-text archive of biomedical and life sciences journal article at the U.S. National Institutes of Health’s National Library of Medicine.

entry.title: Medical Imaging AI on AWS Workshop

link.title: Medical Imaging AI on AWS Workshop

entry.content:
This workshop presents an AWS solution by running open source MONAI label on EC2 virtual machine with autoscaling, which has been mounted to the same Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) volume shared with Amazon Sagemaker Studio notebook instances. Through the common file share, clinicians and data scientists can collaborate on the same data sets through different tools that they are familiar with. Amazon AppStream 2.0 is used to stream an image computing platform, named 3D Slicer for interactive medical image annotation for clinicians.

Link to the workshop
entry.summary: This workshop presents an AWS solution by running open source MONAI label on EC2 virtual machine with autoscaling, which has been mounted to the same Amazon Elastic File System (EFS) volume shared with Amazon Sagemaker Studio notebook instances. Through the common file share, clinicians and data scientists can collaborate on the same data sets through different tools that they are familiar with. Amazon AppStream 2.0 is used to stream an image computing platform, named 3D Slicer for interactive medical image annotation for clinicians.
